content: मुग्ध {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [मुह्-क्त] {@--1@} Stupefied. fainted. {@--2@} Perplexed, infatuated. {@--3@} Foolish, ignorant, silly, stupid; शशांक केन मुग्धेन सुधांशुरिति भाषितः <ls>Bv. 2. 29</ls>; अयि मुग्धे कान्या चिंता प्रियास्तमागमस्य <ls>V. 3.</ls> {@--4@} Simple, artless, innocent; <ls>U. 1. 46</ls>; <ls>Māl. 7. 1.</ls> {@--5@} Erring, mistaken. {@--6@} Attractive by youthful simplicity (not yet acquainted with love), child-like; (कः) अयमाचरत्यविनयं मुग्धासु तपस्विकन्यासु <ls>Ś. 1. 25</ls>; <ls>U. 6. 35</ls>; <ls>R. 9. 34.</ls> {@--7@} (Hence) Beautiful, lovely, charming, pretty; हरिरिह मुग्धवधूनिकरे विलासिनि विलसति केलिपरे <ls>Gīt. 1</ls>; <ls>U. 3. 5.</ls> --ग्धा A young girl attractive by her youthful simplicity, a pretty young maiden; (regarded as a variety of Nāyikā in poetic compositions).
